lines.text: Odie, you're so stupid you don't even know you're in big trouble. I may never see you again.

[scratching the arm rest of a chair he's sitting in]
Oh boy, am I bored.
[sighs]

I guess I miss Odie. It's hard to believe I could miss someone who stares and slobbers all the same time. Someone who has to turn around three times before lying down. Someone who drinks out of a toilet.
[stops scratching]
I remember when Odie and I were just puppy and kitten.

[after rudely waking Jon up]
Good morning sunshine. Welcome to another fun-filled day with your favorite pet.

[Odie barks and scares Garfield]
Good morning, Odie. You're not gonna to live to see your next birthday, you know that don't you? I hate dogs.
[sighs]
Well, as long as I'm up, as may as well have breakfast.
What would you like for breakfast, Garfield?
Oh, a cup of coffee, Danish, morning paper.
OK, one bowl of catfood coming right up.
Nobody listens anymore.

[on the phone]
Hello, City Pound? This is Hubert on Main Street; I've got a couple of customers for you.
[bellows]
Send a truck right over!
[truck promptly pulls up]
What took you so long?
[bellows again]
Get that cat and that dog, and take them away!
I'm so happy to own a cat.
Show me a good mouser, and I'll show you a cat with bad breath.
Where's Odie? He didn't come back with you?
[does a complicated pantomime explaining that Odie was taken to the pound]
You got fleas or something?

[grabs Jon's face]
What we have here is a failure to communicate.

I'm bored. Bored, bored, bored, bored, bored, bored, bored, bored. I'm bored... that's it! I'm going down to the City Pound, and I'm gonna break Odie outta there! Look out, Pound, here comes Garfield!

[playing with the food]
No sweat, 'Sarge, I'll take that machine gun nest out with my trusty bazooka here!
[switch]
So this is what it feels like to be potato salad, yuck!
[switch]
Rhett, Rhett, whatever shall I do? Wherever shall I go?
[switch]
Take me to your leader, earthling, or I'll atomize your face, heh heh!
Reba! Reba! That cat and dog are in my yard again! Where's my stick?
It's right beside you where you always keep it, dear.
I know that!
[Reba exits into the house]
[picks up his stick and turns to Garfield and Odie]

[gently]
Come here kitty, come here doggy, I want to pet you...
[harshly]
with my stick!
[swings his stick at them repeatedly, misses and instead brings a hanging plant down on his head; Garfield and Odie give each other fives]

[reentering the porch]
Well, just look at you, Hubert, potted again!
[laughs]
Dagnabbit Reba, can't you see I've been assaulted by those pesky varmits? Bring me the phone!
[to Garfield and Odie]
You've done it this time! I'm gonna fix your wagon once and for all!

[Garfield turns the TV on]
You know Pleasure Motors.
[Garfield switches the channel]
You know Pleasure Motors is conveniently located right here in Downtown.
[switches channel]
Of course, if you can't make it around Downtown, okay, we have new locations under construction in Midtown...
[switches channel]
Uptown...
[switches channel]
and in the Loop.
[switches channel]
To Pleasure Motors, your business is our pleasure.
[switches channel]
For our pleasure is your business.
[switches channel]
Then our pleasure is none of your business.
[turns the TV off]

[sighs]
I hate mornings. I'd like 'em better if they started later.

[after he and Odie kiss Jon]
Home is where they understand you.
It's pathetic the way some animals beg at the table. Where is your pride, Odie?

[referring to Odie]
Ten billion dogs in this world, and I get Tweedledee the Wonder Dummy.

[after he knocks Odie off the table]
I'm not known for my compassion.
When I want in, I want in now.

[after he throws Jon's breakfast in his face; last line]
I'm only human.

[seeing his empty cat food bowl]
Rats. My owner must still be wallowing around in bed. It's hard to find good help these days.
You know, Garfield, I wouldn't have to feed you so much if you would provide for yourself. Why don't you chase mice, too, like other cats?
Well, I suppose you boys had a big night, singing on the fence, chasing cars, while sat home and worried myself *sick* over you.
[Garfield and Odie nod in unison]
I thought so.

[yawns]
Well, it's time to hit the sack.
Sack?
[looks around hurriedly yet excitedly]
What sack?

[pointing to the floor]
*That* sack.
Come on, get in line!
What for?
There's a family coming in to adopt a cat or a dog. This could be our way out!
Our way out!
